name: Andres Gutierrez
overview: FIELD SYNOPSIS: Journalist whose investigative work intersected with restricted operations prior to abduction. Post-alteration, subject exhibits enhanced pattern recognition, intrusive cognitive probing capability, and compulsive information-gathering behavior. Functions as de facto analyst and interrogator for associated Renegade cluster, with growing awareness of Conspiracy methodology and infrastructure. Threat assessment: AMBER; primary risk lies in subject's ability to correlate disparate data streams and expose assets rather than in direct physical confrontation.

merits.narrative: Years on Mexico City's investigative desk drilled Andres in Investigation, Firearms, and Persuasion, so he juggles sources, forensics, and pressure interviews like a newsroom veteran.

secondaryMerits.narrative: Andres still trades embargoed drafts and camera-ready favors with prestigious journalists who remember the awards his exposes delivered.
He can still tap the FMP officers he once embedded with, swapping intel for quiet warnings before raids close in.

merits.narrative: Whistleblower shells, prepaid phones, and cash couriers keep Andres' legal identity off registries when a story goes live.
Syndicated columns and danger-pay retainers fund a comfortable freelancer lifestyle with enough left for burner safehouses.
Model-tier poise makes sources drop their guard; Andres weaponizes that camera-ready charm whenever negotiations sour.
He slips between English and Spanish mid-sentence to mirror sources and coax nervous witnesses into talking.
